intro: Halea ludoviciana, commonly known as the Louisiana halea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in wetlands and along riverbanks, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Halea ludoviciana is often found in swampy areas and is adapted to periodic flooding.
